title: Pather Panchali

text: Who is that?
title: Pather Panchali

text: That child! We won't haveany fruit left.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Auntie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The orchard is private property,bought and paid for.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It will have to be fenced inif we're to save any fruit.
title: Pather Panchali

text: There are so many thieves about.
title: Pather Panchali

text: That wretched girl of Hori's.
title: Pather Panchali

text: She's always taking our fruit.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You have to keepyour eyes peeled for her.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I just saw her taking a guavaand who knows what else?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Tell her off.- What's the use?
title: Pather Panchali

text: She'll take no notice of me,she's not my daughter.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It doesn't matter what we say,it's up to her mother.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The mother will be shocked whenshe's shamed before the village.
title: Pather Panchali

text: That child is being badly brought up.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Can I help?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - It's too heavy for you.- I can manage.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did I forget you, Durga? Wait.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Come here.
title: Pather Panchali

text: She's doing no harm, let her stay.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Why should she watch you eat?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Run along to your mother, dear.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you take somethingfrom Mrs. Mukherji's garden?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What are you hiding?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Take them back to her.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Then come back and sweep the yard.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You're spoiling Durga.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - I don't understand.- You do.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You eat the fruit.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The fruit Durga brings you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You should know better,shouldn't you?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You think you can do as you please,living with us.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - I know you.- What do you mean?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You know. Don't you take thingsfrom the kitchen?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Oil, salt, chillies.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Shall I look in your box?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Lost your tongue?
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's got to stop.Maybe you'd better go somewhere else
title: Pather Panchali

text: I've stood it for eight years,my patience is exhausted.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You spoil my daughterand I get the blame for it.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's too much in my old age.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Where are you going?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Auntie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Leave her alone, Durga.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you hear me?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What else did I tell you to do?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Where have you been, Auntie Indir?- I was staying with Raghu.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Then this morningI heard that Hori has...
title: Pather Panchali

text: On my way I found this childcoming to fetch me.
title: Pather Panchali

text: So we met.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Go and see your lovely new nephew.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let me see his face properly.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What a little darling.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What are you cooking?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Pilau, korma... fine dishes.
title: Pather Panchali

text: One day you shall cook them,or have you forgotten how?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I've forgotten.
title: Pather Panchali

text: A pity, I thought we mightcelebrate our son's birth.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - What about money?- I shall start work next month.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Landlord Ray has promised a job,doing his accounts.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you ask about pay?
title: Pather Panchali

text: No, but I shan't slaveas a rent collector for ever.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The money from that job and the feesfor religious ceremonies...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...will keep the family going for now.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Surely you can understand that.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Lucky January: the boy was bornand you got a job.
title: Pather Panchali

text: That's why I think we shouldspend a little...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...and celebrate his birth in style.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's good for our prestige, andpeople will praise your cooking.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Will you be paid regularly?- Why not? Ray is a good man.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You're no judge of that,you've always been cheated.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What do you mean?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What about our garden?
title: Pather Panchali

text: They said my brother owed themmoney when he was alive.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The garden paid off the debt.
title: Pather Panchali

text: If we had the orchard nowwe wouldn't go hungry.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You should hear what they saywhen Durga takes a few guavas.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What do such people matter?I am a scholar.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Who cares about that here?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Listen to what I have in mind.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I am going to write original playsand poems.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I'll soon be in great demand.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The travelling players neednew material.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Most writers are merelyrehashing old stories.
title: Pather Panchali

text: If their stuff is popular...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...shouldn't my stuff beeven more popular?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Of course.
title: Pather Panchali

text: And as a scholar you'll berespected in the village.
title: Pather Panchali

text: And you will teach the boy.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's not long to the festival.
title: Pather Panchali

text: A good match will be found for Durga.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We'll have two good meals a dayand new clothes twice a year.
title: Pather Panchali

text: That's how it will be, my ancestorswere writers, after all.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I keep alive the family tradition.
title: Pather Panchali

text: In two years we'll be livingin comfort, free of debt.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The house will be repaired...and no more spinach every day.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Wake up, Apu, it's time to goto school.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga, wake Apu
title: Pather Panchali

text: I can't make him stir.
title: Pather Panchali

text: There's not much milk, do youfeed the cow properly?
title: Pather Panchali

text: How many more times must youmoisten your duster?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Sit down!
title: Pather Panchali

text: - What do you want?- Puffed rice, please.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Hand over the money, then.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You've netted a fine catch.
title: Pather Panchali

text: How many pupils now?
title: Pather Panchali

text: The new boy makes nine.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The nine gems.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What are you laughing at?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Go on like that and you'llend up behind a plough.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - You were saying, sir?- Have you seen any good plays?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I did see one company.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Gupe, what are you doing?
title: Pather Panchali

text: The next village has bookeda very good company
title: Pather Panchali

text: I'll thrash you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: They thought they'd be one up on us,
title: Pather Panchali

text: but they reckoned without me
title: Pather Panchali

text: I've booked the finest companyanyone's ever seen.
title: Pather Panchali

text: May I have some of your oil?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I've not put you down fora contribution...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...but I'm sure you won't forgetmy needs.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't forget your friend Boidyonath.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Wait, Mr. Chakrabarti.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The drummer...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...of the company...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...sounds like thunder.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Sude, come here and bringyour slate with you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Bring me his slate.
title: Pather Panchali

text: So this is what you've been up to.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Hold out your hand.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What are you doing?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - What are you doing in the kitchen?- Nothing.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Nothing? Didn't I see you takesomething?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I have no chillies, so I thoughtI'd take a couple.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Why didn't you ask?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga, come and help mewhen you are free.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Girls of your age should help aboutthe house, cooking, washing up...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...performing religious rites.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Is it right to skylark about all day?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You must learn to cook, mustn't you?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Are you feverish again today?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Remember to drinkyour herbal tincture.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - I'm hungry.- Haven't you had your puffed rice?
title: Pather Panchali

text: There is rice for you in the bowlask Durga to give you some.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Help me up.
title: Pather Panchali

text: My back is stiff.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - How are you these days?- Who cares about an old woman?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Just look at this.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - It's my shawl for the evenings.- I'll buy you a new one soon.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Can I have a light?
title: Pather Panchali

text: We can't afford so much tobacco.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you ask for your pay today?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Landlord Ray has his own troubles.I might risk my job if I ask now.
title: Pather Panchali

text: There must be other jobsin the town.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You haven't been paidfor three months.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's the first time.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You're happy to let things slide.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga has not been well,she needs medicine and better food.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Apu needs new clothes,he's going to school in rags.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The house needs repairing,debts must be repaid.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We owe Mrs. Mukherji five rupees,she'll press for repayment.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You must do something.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You won't tell mother?
title: Pather Panchali

text: She'll hear you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The sweet-seller.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Halva, fudge, coconut cakes.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Ask father for money.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You ask.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Is he asking for money?Don't pander to him.
title: Pather Panchali

text: None today?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let's follow him to the others.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let me see what you've got.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Coming to play with us, Durga?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Coming? If not, go home,I'll be back soon.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Like a sweet, Durga?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't give them any. If they wantsweets, they should buy their own.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Tunu, come and play.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What lovely beads.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Who gave them to you?- Father.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let me help you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What have things come to, when anold woman has to patch her shawl?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga, come here.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You know it's time to do your hair.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Can you plait four strands?- Don't move your head.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Ranu can.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What dry hair, and we have no oil.Never mind four-stranded plaits.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Some people are coming to seeif Ranu is a suitable bride.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Who are they?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Ever seen a train?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't lie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Do you knowwhere the railway line is?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Over the big meadow,beyond the rice fields.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let's go there.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Now write the word... wealth.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Were you good at school?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You're so tiny, do the other boystease you?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I'm not surprised he's left it.
title: Pather Panchali

text: He gets nothing but rice,but what else can I afford?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Wash your face.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Where's Durga?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Shall I fetch her toy-box?
title: Pather Panchali

text: She's not well brought up.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What has happened?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga has stolen Tunu's beads.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't look astonished, she isan accomplished thief.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Her father bought the beads in town.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Tunu showed Durga.
title: Pather Panchali

text: This morning the beads had vanished.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga hasn't been back, anyway,are you sure she took them?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Are you suggesting we've invented it?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - The string could have broken.- It didn't.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We've searched everywhere.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you take Tunu's beads?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Didn't you?
title: Pather Panchali

text: She's a liar.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Where do you suppose she gotthat fruit?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What's the matter? What's going on?
title: Pather Panchali

text: The garden isn't ours,it's wrong to take the fruit.
title: Pather Panchali

text: But how can you accuse her ofstealing something bought for money?
title: Pather Panchali

text: She's a child.Fruit has no name on it.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Listen to that! The rupees I lent youhad no name on...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...had they?
title: Pather Panchali

text: When will you pay them back?I can't wait forever.
title: Pather Panchali

text: When you find the beadsI hope you'll return them.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Our fruit disappears. I complainand the mother says:
title: Pather Panchali

text: Suppose the children take it,fruit has no name on it.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Like mother, like daughter:a pair of thieves.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Come here.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Tell Durga to come in for her meal.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Then came an ogress,hobble, cackle, gobble.
title: Pather Panchali

text: "I smell humans!Who is awake in my temple?"
title: Pather Panchali

text: Iue Lotus Prince kept guardwhile Red Lotus Prince slept.
title: Pather Panchali

text: And at midnight the ogresscame once more.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Hobble, cackle, gobble.
title: Pather Panchali

text: "Who is awake in my temple?"
title: Pather Panchali

text: Father's home.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Give mother the fish.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Put it down.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Come here, I have lots to tell you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: No matter what people say...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...landlord Ray is a good man.
title: Pather Panchali

text: My three months' wages.
title: Pather Panchali

text: First I will say evening prayers,then I have much to tell you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Today I met a rich farmer.I don't know him...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...but he greeted meand said my father knew him.
title: Pather Panchali

text: He said my father officiatedas a priest in his household.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Now he wants me to performthe same duties.
title: Pather Panchali

text: They're having a religiousceremony next month.
title: Pather Panchali

text: He wants me to baptise them.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - They are rich.- Have you agreed?
title: Pather Panchali

text: If I agree straight away,they'll think we are starving.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Accept at once.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The trouble is that some peoplewill criticize if they know.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Who will know?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You might talk, you knowwhat women are like
title: Pather Panchali

text: I have better things to dowith my time.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't be upset. The clientwon't run away.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I mustn't seem over-eager, he canwait until after the festival.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We'll manage on my wages until then.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The children need new clothesand Auntie needs a shawl.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We owe Mrs. Mukherji five rupees.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We'll have to pay all thatout of the wages.
title: Pather Panchali

text: And the repairs?
title: Pather Panchali

text: We have survived the monsoon.
title: Pather Panchali

text: The repairs must wait,but I'll get estimates.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Something must be done to the kitchen.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't worry. Kitchen, walls, roof,everything will be done.
title: Pather Panchali

text: How many days to the festival?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Twenty-one.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Did you take Tunu's beads?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Do you know who did?- No. Go to sleep
title: Pather Panchali

text: I have another idea for a play.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I might be able to write it in a week.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You once lived in Benares,did you have friends there?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I had a few.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Isn't there a place by the river...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...where men recite fromthe scriptures?
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's called Dasasvamedh Ghat.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Let's go to Benares.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't the orators earn lots of money?
title: Pather Panchali

text: We can't go. How can we?
title: Pather Panchali

text: This is my ancestral home,how can I leave it?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Why not? You were awayeight years before.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You left me at my father'sand never wrote.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Then I did not know how sweet you are.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Save your compliments.
title: Pather Panchali

text: This is my home, too.
title: Pather Panchali

text: But look at it: it's likeliving in the forest.
title: Pather Panchali

text: At night the jackals prowl around.
title: Pather Panchali

text: There are no neighboursI can talk to.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You are not always hereand sometimes I'm so depressed.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You won't understand these things.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You live in your work. Sometimesyou're paid, sometimes not
title: Pather Panchali

text: I had dreams, too, of all the thingsI would do.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Those who came before are gone.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I am left behind,a penniless beggar.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Day draws to its close,night's mantle descends.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Row me across to the other side.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Hurry with the twigs, this woodis too damp to light.
title: Pather Panchali

text: A new shawl, Auntie? How nice.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What a lovely shawl, Auntie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Raju gave it to me, to keep mewarm in the evenings.
title: Pather Panchali

text: We're having a picnic,please cook something.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Why is it never her turnto go and fetch things?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What's the matter?
title: Pather Panchali

text: What's that shawl?
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's a present from Raju.
title: Pather Panchali

text: A present, was it?
title: Pather Panchali

text: You didn't ask?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Why should I?
title: Pather Panchali

text: I just remarked that the eveningswere chilly, so he said...
title: Pather Panchali

text: Would he feed you, too?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't be angry. I did ask Horifor a shawl.
title: Pather Panchali

text: And as he couldn't give it to youat once, you went begging.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You should be ashamed.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Can't an old woman have whims?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Whims?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Don't you realize that the childrenoften go hungry?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Are you going to dress and feed them?
title: Pather Panchali

text: If you're staying here, stop begging,otherwise, go away.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I can always findsomewhere else to go.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Fine! Take yourself off.
title: Pather Panchali

text: You'd better go, you can'tstay here any longer.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's lovely, your husbandwill enjoy your cooking.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - When is the wedding?- I've forgotten.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I know when.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It's in two months, isn't it?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - What does it feel like?- Much the same.
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Tell me.- You'll find out.
title: Pather Panchali

text: It won't happen to me,I just know it won't.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Your mother is arranging a match,just wait and see.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Raju, are you at home?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - Who is it?- Your old auntie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I wonder whether you can take me in,just for a few days?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Only a few days.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I get no peace at the other place,nothing but nagging.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Come in.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Tell your mother that Auntiehas come to stay.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Bring her a chair and a bowl of water
title: Pather Panchali

text: I've nowhere to go now I'm old,so I thought of you.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Beware, King! If you utterthose words again...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...I shall cut out your tongue...
title: Pather Panchali

text: ...and throw it to the jackalsand the dogs!
title: Pather Panchali

text: And I shall destroy you,for the good of the world!
title: Pather Panchali

text: Father, do not do it, I beseech you!
title: Pather Panchali

text: Durga, go and find the calf.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Please tie this on for me.
title: Pather Panchali

text: Apu, let's look for Auntie.
title: Pather Panchali

text: I want you to find the calf first.
title: Pather Panchali

text: What's that?
title: Pather Panchali

text: Who gave you the silver paper?
title: Pather Panchali

text: - He's been at my toy-box.- You're too old for a toy-box now.
